title: Elon Musk is trying to pit ChatGPT against its owner as his feud with Sam Altman escalates
description: Musk said on Monday that he will sue Apple over its bias toward OpenAI on the App Store.
content: Elon Musk is turning to ChatGPT to adjudicate his long-running feud with Sam Altman.Musk posted a screenshot of a query to ChatGPT 5 Pro on Tuesday, asking if he or Altman was "more trustworthy." ChatGPT chose Musk."There you have it," Musk wrote.Business Insider posed the same query as Musk to ChatGPT eight times, testing it across the GPT 5 Pro, GPT 5 Thinking, and GPT 5 models. ChatGPT picked Musk once, while it was set to GPT-5 Thinking. The rest of the attempts returned Altman, including when it was toggled to GPT-5 Thinking again.Musk and OpenAI did not respond to requests for comment from Business Insider.Later, Musk posted the screenshot in response to an X post from OpenAI's ChatGPT account. The account had shared a query to Musk's chatbot, Grok, asking if Musk was right to say Apple had committed antitrust violations.Musk threatened to sue Apple on Monday over what he said was its bias toward OpenAI on the App Store.But Grok — in a response reposted by the official ChatGPT X account — disagreed with Musk's opinion of the Apple rankings."Good bot," the OpenAI-affiliated account said of Grok's response, adding that Grok was very "truth-seeking.""You too," Musk replied.You too pic.twitter.com/eFMypoCi97Musk cofounded OpenAI with Altman in 2015 but left its board in 2018. Since then, Musk has publicly criticized Altman's leadership of OpenAI.Last year, Musk filed a lawsuit against OpenAI, accusing the company of violating its nonprofit mission when it partnered with Microsoft.Musk launched his AI startup, xAI, in July 2023. Grok, its first chatbot, was released in the same year.Musk isn't the only one who has tried to pit a chatbot against its creator. In May, Altman asked Grok if it would pick him or Musk to lead the AI arms race if the fate of humanity was at stake."If forced, I'd lean toward Musk for his safety emphasis, critical for humanity's survival, though Altman's accessibility is vital. Ideally, their strengths should combine with regulation to ensure AI benefits all," Grok said in response to Altman's query.
summary: Elon Musk is attempting to pit ChatGPT against its owner, Sam Altman, in a bid to resolve his ongoing feud with Altman. The company's CEO, who cofounded OpenAI in 2015, recently threatened to sue Apple over its bias towards OpenAI on the App Store. However, a response from ChatGTT's official account, however, disagreed with Musk's assessment of Apple's rankings. This comes after Altman asked the chatbot if it would pick him or Musk to lead the AI arms race if the fate of humanity was at stake.
shortSummary: Elon Musk is feuding with Sam Altman over trust, and is using ChatGPT to decide who is trustworthy.
argos_summary: Elon Musk is using ChatGPT to settle his ongoing rivalry with Sam Altman, asking the AI which of them is more trustworthy. While Musk shared a screenshot where ChatGPT favored him, Business Insider's tests showed mixed results, with Altman being chosen more frequently. The feud has escalated with Musk threatening legal action against Apple for alleged bias towards OpenAI, and he recently launched his own AI startup, xAI, which includes a chatbot named Grok.
